runs.comm: tossed up slowly outside off stump, the batsman gets down on one knee and ties to sweep, but gets beaten by the lack of pace
defended on the front foot on the of side
Ura steps out of his crease but isn't to the pitch of another floated delivery, he ends up defending awkwardly
once again he fails to connect with the sweep, the impact on the pad is outside off and the get a leg bye towards short third man
bowled full on of and middle, Siaka drives past short midwicket for a single
defended on the leg side but into a gap for a single
a full ball on middle and leg, Ura turns if off his pads
strays on to the pads, the batsman tries to flick but the ball slides past the face and hits the pad before going to short fine leg
Siaka gets on to the front foot and defends, or tries to at least, as the ball leaps off a good length and moves slightly away from the right-hander to beat the bat

jumps back and dabs the ball close on the leg side, Ura sets off but Siaka is slow to respond, he eventually gets going but is lucky that the bowler did not pick up the ball cleanly after running quickly to reach it
dabbed close on the off side for another quick single
short of a length angling into the right-hander, played off the back foot behind square for one more
short of a length angling across the right hander, played with soft hands close on the off side for a sharp single, the throw misses at the striker's end
good length on middle and off, defended on the off side. That's a long way to run for a 132 kph delivery ...
good length on middle and off again, not much space for the batsman to work with, that was 135 kph. The batsman defends it on the off side
that was measured at 124 kph, good length but the line is on leg stump, the batsman misses the glance and is hit on the pad, a leg bye close on the leg side
that bounced sharply from short of a length though the pace was measured only at 128 kph, the batsman fended and was beaten outside off
defended on the front foot on the off side, played with soft hands again so there's time for a single
short of a length on the hips, the batsman fails to connect with the glance and gets a leg bye behind square
turned off the pads behind square for a single, off the bat this time

caught behind! That was some delivery from Dawlat ... he pitched it just short of a length and got it to bounce sharply and seam away at pace from the right-hander. Siaka barely moved his feet as he tried to drive from his crease, the bounce was too much for that shot and he got an edge to the wicket-keeper
Vala makes crisp contact first ball, leaning forward and driving a full ball towards point
good length and straight to the left-hander, Vala gets behind the line and defends
top stuff from Dawlat, hits a good length around off, making the batsman poke at the ball and then skids it across the left-hander to beat the bat

caught behind again, the other Zadran strikes! He pitched short of a length and Ura could not handle the bounce with his pull shot. He got a faint top edge through to the keeper, who flings the ball in the air in celebration. That ball came on to Ura quite quickly.
Vani Vagi moves forward to his first ball and pushes it on the off side

it's all happening, but no harm done to PNG in the end! The batsman digs out a full ball close on the leg side and begins to run, his partner isn't responding so the striker has to abort and about turn. Shapoor runs to his right to get to the ball but fumbles with the batsman a long way out ... a fielder then gets to the ball and throws at the striker's end, but hits the retreating batsman instead
short ball down leg side, that's a wide, the batsman tries to pull but it was too far away
played to third man for a single
nudged off the pads on the leg side for a single, he used the angle of the delivery coming into him from over the wicket to play that
good length on middle and off stump, defended on the off side
Vala tries to drive off the front foot at a good length ball that pitches around off and slants across the left-hander, he is beaten
short of a length - a loud grunt from the bowler, the extra effort in that ball is evident - and the batsman adjusts to the bounce and dabs it towards third man
steps out of his crease but is in no position to play an attacking shot, he plays the good length delivery back to the bowler
tucked off the pads towards square leg for a single
once again Dawlat beats the bat with one that pitches on a perfect length around off and zips across the left-hander ... 137kph that was
good length outside off, the batsman stays back and pushes towards point for another quick single
a full ball on the pads, the batsman tries to flick from the crease and he gets a leading edge towards point
driven through covers for a single
an appeal for lbw but that pitched outside leg, I think. the impact on the pad was outside leg too. The batsman tried to flick but missed. They run a leg bye after the ball goes behind point
the first boundary of the innings, via an outside edge. The batsman drove hard at the ball from the crease and with the keeper standing up the ball raced to the third man boundary
played with soft hands behind point and my word these PNG batsmen are quick between the wickets, that was a sprint for two.
tries to drive on the front foot but gets an inside edge which takes the ball on the off side via a rebound off the pds
tossed up slowly on off and middle, the batsman defends from his crease

that's out, it's got to be ... the umpire eventually raises the finger! The batsman tried to sweep but was too early on the shot because Nabi's pace was so slow, the ball beat the bat and hit him in line with off stump. On second thought, replays show the impact on the pad being marginal on off stump
played off the pads through square leg for a single
plays a paddle swat through square leg for a single
moves forward and across to work the ball through the leg side

good length angling into the batsman, worked on the leg side for a quick single, Hassan moves towards the stumps to collect the ball and the batsman thuds into him ... Hassan grimaces as he feels his back
an appeal for lbw but there was an inside edge, they run a risky single, a direct hit at the non striker's end would have been close
another single taken on the leg side
jumps out of his crease to try and hit through the off side but is beaten by the extra bounce
bowls it wide outside off stump, the batsman had moved towards the off side before the bowler released so it isn't a wide though the ball was outside the tram lines
cut off the back foot towards point

that looks pretty close too and the umpire agrees! That ball pitched in line from over the wicket to the left-hander and then went across, the batsman moved forward to drive but was hit on the pad. Was that missing off stump? Maybe just clipping ...
Charles Amini spoons his first ball in the air but over cover ...
good length on leg and middle, the batsman stays back and defends on the leg side
played in front of square leg for a single
steps out to a full ball and nearly ends up yorking himself, digs it out towards point for a quick single
driven towards long off for a single
angles the ball into the pads and Amini flicks behind square for runs
bowled full on middle and leg, driven to long on for a single
stays back to get on top of the bounce and then square cuts to deep point
heaved towards cow corner, not timed well though so the boundary count remains stuck on one
drags the ball from wide outside off stump with a controlled swat and hits it through midwicket
a full ball angling into the left-hander from over the wicket, driven to long on
pushed from the crease towards point, there is absolutely no pace on Nabi's deliveries
played back to the bowler
once again it is slow and loopy from Nabi, but the line is on the pads, the batsman does not connect with the glance
goes deep into the crease to drive the ball through point, PNG pass 50 ...
steps out of his crease and defends on the leg side
punched off the back foot towards the bowler
the batsman attempts a big booming drive at a length ball outside off and is beaten
charges out of the crease to slog but is beaten by a slower ball
shot! The batsman moves across his stumps, exposing all three, and then gets down low to scoop a full ball wide of the keeper for the innings' second boundary

he's ramped it this time, and ramped it straight to third man! The batsman swayed back and angled his bat to let the ball bounce off it but got neither the height or the distance to clear the fielder on the boundary
good length on off and middle, the batsman stays in his crease and defends on the off side, Shapoor carries on during his follow through to go field the ball
Amini tries to chip a short and fast delivery over the keeper but the pace and bounce is just too much for him to get any bat on it
leans forward and nudges the ball off his pads through square
goes back and tries to pull, the ball bounces off several things - thigh, arms - and finally lodges behind the knee flap of the pad
beaten on the sweep outside off stump
played to long on, and they run a risky second run, a direct hit at the bowler's end would have been out
defended on the off side
pushed towards midwicket but the fielder moves quickly to prevent the single
moves across his stumps and gets down low to paddle the ball behind square leg
moves across his stumps to flick but the ball slants down leg side
the fielder at point dives to his right to make a superb save, can't prevent the quick single though. Great stuff from Shenwari
beaten by a slower ball
moves back and across to work the ball off his pads but doesn't time it well
a full delivery on middle stump, the batsman moves across and flicks behind square for a single
dabbed gently towards midwicket for one more
pushed into the covers for a quick single
picked off the pads and lofted over the infield towards deep midwicket
that's the first six of the innings! Amini goes back and pulls a short ball, hitting it with the wind over the deep midwicket boundary
played through midwicket for two more
short of a length outside off, pulled off the back foot towards long on
nicely placed that! Vare moves towards the off side and swings a length ball from just outside off behind square leg for four
moves outside off and gets down low to sweep the ball, he doesn't make proper contact, I think the ball went towards short fine leg off the back of the bat
played through the off side for a single
driven to long on for a single
a full toss around off stump, swatted through square leg but the placement isn't in the gap
steps out to drive the ball through point for one more
bowled him! Hassan bowls a full one that swings into the right-hander, the batsman aimed for a flick towards midwicket and the ball bent past the bat to hit off stump
Shapoor swings the ball - looks like it is reversing - into the left hander, the impact on the pad is outside leg as the batsman misses the flick. Afghanistan allow an extra run via an overthrow
another full ball down leg side, the batsman flicks but the ball speeds past the bat and clips the pad before beating short fine leg to reach the boundary
another full ball angles into the batsman's pads, Amini tries to heave over the leg side but misses and the ball goes on the off side off the pad
steps out to hit the ball through the off side but misses, that ball was in the blockhole outside off
beaten outside the off stump, this is excellent death bowling from Shapoor
eight runs off the over, only one off the bat though. Shapoor ends a top spell with another one nearly in the blockhole, the batsman digs it out to long on
the ball flies off the outside edge to the third man boundary, the batsman charged and swung hard at a length ball
a length ball and the batsman gives it the charge and swings hard, launching it far over the deep square leg boundary
drilled through covers for four more, PNG finishing decently
in the blockhole almost, the batsman stays in his crease and plays on the leg side
Amini moves across his stumps to tap a full toss behind square for four
punched off the front foot into the covers, 20 runs off that over
full ball outside off, played towards point
in the blockhole, dug out towards mid off for a single
slogged down to long on for a single, but the batsmen decide they can make it back for two and they do
a low full toss wide outside off, Amini heaves it down the ground with imperfect timing
that's a deft shot! Vanua moves towards the off side, gets down low, keeps his balance, and scoops the ball over the head of the fielder at short fine leg
charges and hits the full toss through midwicket for a single
